data.title: Arthur Baker Hosts 'Baker's Revenge' on Studio 54 Radio
data.meta_description: Record producer Arthur Baker shares his musical influences, favorite records, and even a few selections from his private vault.
data.text:
Prolific record producer and remixer Arthur Baker is getting his revenge on his new show, Baker’s Revenge, premiering December 21 at 12pm ET on SiriusXM’s Studio 54 Radio.

How to listen to Baker’s Revenge

Arthur Baker hosts Baker’s Revenge every Thursday at 12pm ET exclusively on Studio 54 Radio (Ch. 54).

What you’ll hear on Baker’s Revenge

A play on the title of his famous 1984 electro hit “Breaker’s Revenge,” Baker’s Revenge sees Arthur dive into his decade’s-long career while sharing his musical influences, favorite records, and even a few selections from his private vault of remixes, recordings, and rarities that have never seen the light of day.

Arthur will also pay homage to the city he now calls home in each episode with a special “Miami Moment,” celebrating the culture and sound that has shaped Miami over the years of his career.

About Arthur Baker

An influential American record producer and DJ, Arthur Baker is recognized for his pioneering work in the realms of hip-hop, electro, and dance music. Hailing from Boston, MA, Baker rose to prominence during the 1980s as a key figure in the development of electronic music.

His collaborations with artists such as Afrika Bambaataa and New Order produced iconic tracks like “Planet Rock” and “Confusion.” Baker’s innovative use of drum machines and synthesizers helped shape the sound of the burgeoning hip-hop and dance scenes. With a career spanning several decades, Arthur Baker remains a respected figure in the music industry, celebrated for his contributions to the evolution of electronic and dance music.
